text: I always wanted to make movies.
author: Daniel Craig

text: If I wanted to make spy movies for the rest of my life, that would be one thing, but I don't want to just make spy movies.
author: Daniel Craig

text: Some people think literature is high culture and that it should only have a small readership. I don't think so... I have to compete with popular culture, including TV, magazines, movies and video games.
author: Haruki Murakami

text: It's the contemporary woman that movies don't know what to do with, other than bathe her in a bridal glow in romantic comedies where both the romance and the comedy are artificial sweeteners.
author: James Wolcott

text: People talk about mumblecore but I prefer bumblecore, hyper-realistic bee movies about how bees really are.
